kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
One additional note - you can [generate C# code files](https://docs.kentico.com/x/5IbWCQ) for Forms defined in your project.
While it's not the form "schema", it is the form data structure. This could give you a strongly typed API for form retrieval or persistence.
There's an example [in the Kentico Community Portal](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v30.1.0.11/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Web/Components/Widgets/Activities/CommunityLeaderActivityListWidget.cs#L123).
Maybe you can combine this with the [Form data management APIs](https://docs.kentico.com/api/digital-marketing/form-data#update-the-data-records-of-a-form) to get what you want. However, any custom validation or Form Component behavior (business rules baked into the Form itself) will not apply here.
